definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: The popular sports in the country include football and water polo.
sentences.chinese: 國內的大衆體育項目有足球和水球。

sentences.english: For example swimming and water polo are disciplines of the sport Aquatics.
sentences.chinese: 比如游泳和水球都是水上運動的分項。

sentences.english: Water polo was originally planned to be hosted in the venue but was moved to the Ying Tung Natatorium.
sentences.chinese: 水球原定場地舉行，但被轉移到英東遊泳館。

sentences.english: Roberto was fired after the water polo team had been below par.
sentences.chinese: 由於水球隊表演欠佳，羅伯託被解僱了。

sentences.english: To their great surprise,Tom's team was defeated in the polo game.
sentences.chinese: 令大家喫驚的是，湯姆的球隊在水球隊比賽中輸了。

sentences.english: Wang Wei soon got himself interested in water-polo.
sentences.chinese: 王偉很快使自己喜歡上水球運動。
不過這將消耗一個水球。

sentences.english: Thus when the balloon pops, it's the popping noise that triggers the shot.
sentences.chinese: 所以，當水球爆炸時，正是它的爆炸聲觸發了照相。

sentences.english: These include sessions of judo, badminton and water polo.
sentences.chinese: 這方面包括柔道，羽毛球和水球。

sentences.english: Some were playing water-polo in the backwater.
sentences.chinese: 有些人在回水河汊玩水球。

sentences.english: The water polo was developed in Europe and termed as softball water polo first.
sentences.chinese: 水球起源於歐洲，最初被稱爲“水止壘球”。

sentences.english: Water polo is an intensely aggressive sport, so fouls are very common.
sentences.chinese: 水球是一項攻擊性極強的運動，因此犯規很常見。

sentences.english: His head of engineering, for example, was on the Stanford water polo team.
sentences.chinese: 例如，他現在的工程部經理原來就是斯坦福水球隊的。

sentences.english: The players of the competition type are the most suitable to the requirements of water polo.
sentences.chinese: 競爭型運動員最適合水球運動的要求。

sentences.english: 'I never intended to 'specialise' in water balloons,' he added.
sentences.chinese: “我從來都沒有打算“專門研究”水球，”他補充道。

sentences.english: And flippaball is in the water, so you need to tread water the whole time.
sentences.chinese: 而且水球是在水裏，你一直都要踩水。

definition: water screen (screen formed of sprayed water droplets, used for displaying projected images, for temperature control, or for air purification)
stream of water (as from a fountain or a faucet)/jet of water
cricket (ball game)/also called 板球[ban3 qiu2]
